forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers after 5am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 57. West northwest wind around 17 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Columbus Day
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers before 11am, then showers and thunderstorms. Mostly cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. West wind 6 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As a cool murmur envelops Downtown San Francisco, the city rests beneath a blanket of clouds, with the scent of rain imminent in the air. The damp chill hints at an incoming deluge, carrying the promise of showers by dawn, accompanied by gusts that dance through the streets, whispering secrets of the storm. The temperature lingers around a mild 57 degrees, just cool enough to warrant a light jacket or a snug sweater as the evening unfolds into morning.

With the promise of a tempestuous Columbus Day looming, the city prepares for a day marked by relentless clouds and thundering skies. Residents should expect their umbrellas to become familiar companions, as rain showers give way to thunderstorms throughout the day. The atmospheric pressure feels alive with anticipation, suggesting that perhaps some indoor activities may be in order—curling up with a good book in a cozy café or visiting an art exhibit to escape the drumming rain outside. As the day wanes, consider the warmth of comfort food at a local bistro or the ease of unwinding at home, all while the city’s rhythm pulses with the vibrancy of the storm.
